etymology.description: 免 (exempt; avoid) + 费 (fee; expense) = free of charge
etymology.interpretation: Indicates that a service, product, or event doesn't require payment. Common in notices and offers, modifying nouns (免费门票) or verbs (免费提供).
etymology.simplification: 費 was simplified to 费 to reduce stroke count by streamlining the complex 貝-based structure; 免 remained unchanged.

parts.english: to exempt; to excuse; to avoid; to spare
expense; fee; to spend; to waste

examples.chinese: 这家博物馆免费开放(這家博物館免費開放)。
examples.english: This museum is open free of charge.

examples.chinese: 购买一送一的饮料，第二杯免费(購買一送一的飲料，第二杯免費)。
examples.pinyin: Gòumǎi yī sòng yī de yǐnliào, dì èr bēi miǎnfèi.
examples.english: For buy-one-get-one drinks, the second cup is free.

examples.chinese: 作为新用户，你可以免费试用三天(作為新用戶，你可以免費試用三天)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi xīn yònghù, nǐ kěyǐ miǎnfèi shìyòng sān tiān.
examples.english: As a new user, you can try it free for three days.
